about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from:

about.name: When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from:

hasPart.assesses: When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from: | When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Begin and end the turn in the lane nearest the right-hand curb. Do not swing wide into another lane of traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: The lane closest to the center of the road.

comment.text: The lane closest to the center of the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.

comment.text: The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.

suggestedAnswer.text: Either lane, depending on oncoming traffic.

comment.text: Either lane, depending on oncoming traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.

comment.text: The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.

answerExplanation.text: Begin and end the turn in the lane nearest the right-hand curb. Do not swing wide into another lane of traffic.

comment.text: When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from: | Begin and end the turn in the lane nearest the right-hand curb. Do not swing wide into another lane of traffic.

hasPart.name: You may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if the yellow line next to:

hasPart.assesses: You may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if the yellow line next to: | You may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if the yellow line next to: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Double yellow lines in the center of the road indicate that you may pass if a broken line is next to your driving lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: The other side of the road is a solid line.

comment.text: The other side of the road is a solid line.

suggestedAnswer.text: Your side of the road is a broken line.

comment.text: Your side of the road is a broken line.

suggestedAnswer.text: The other side of the road is a broken line.

comment.text: The other side of the road is a broken line.

acceptedAnswer.text: Your side of the road is a broken line.

comment.text: Your side of the road is a broken line.

answerExplanation.text: Double yellow lines in the center of the road indicate that you may pass if a broken line is next to your driving lane.

comment.text: You may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if the yellow line next to: | Double yellow lines in the center of the road indicate that you may pass if a broken line is next to your driving lane.

hasPart.name: While in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:

about.name: While in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:

hasPart.assesses: While in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is: | While in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: It is illegal to operate a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol. Neither drivers nor passengers may possess an open container of alcohol in a motor vehicle while it is in operation.

suggestedAnswer.text: Illegal to either drink from or possess open containers of alcohol.

comment.text: Illegal to either drink from or possess open containers of alcohol.

suggestedAnswer.text: Legal to drink alcohol if you're not driving.

comment.text: Legal to drink alcohol if you're not driving.

suggestedAnswer.text: Legal to drink alcohol if you're driving but not drunk.

comment.text: Legal to drink alcohol if you're driving but not drunk.

acceptedAnswer.text: Illegal to either drink from or possess open containers of alcohol.

comment.text: Illegal to either drink from or possess open containers of alcohol.

answerExplanation.text: It is illegal to operate a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol. Neither drivers nor passengers may possess an open container of alcohol in a motor vehicle while it is in operation.

comment.text: While in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is: | It is illegal to operate a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol. Neither drivers nor passengers may possess an open container of alcohol in a motor vehicle while it is in operation.

hasPart.name: When driving on gravel or dirt roads:

about.name: When driving on gravel or dirt roads:

hasPart.assesses: When driving on gravel or dirt roads: | When driving on gravel or dirt roads: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Your tires do not have as much traction on loose gravel and dirt roads as they do on concrete and asphalt roads. When driving on gravel or dirt, you must slow down. It will take you much longer to stop and it is much easier to skid when turning.

suggestedAnswer.text: Your tires grip the road better than when you are driving on pavement.

comment.text: Your tires grip the road better than when you are driving on pavement.

suggestedAnswer.text: Your tires do not have as much traction as they do on pavement, so you must slow down.

comment.text: Your tires do not have as much traction as they do on pavement, so you must slow down.

suggestedAnswer.text: Visibility is better than on pavement.

comment.text: Visibility is better than on pavement.

acceptedAnswer.text: Your tires do not have as much traction as they do on pavement, so you must slow down.

comment.text: Your tires do not have as much traction as they do on pavement, so you must slow down.

answerExplanation.text: Your tires do not have as much traction on loose gravel and dirt roads as they do on concrete and asphalt roads. When driving on gravel or dirt, you must slow down. It will take you much longer to stop and it is much easier to skid when turning.

comment.text: When driving on gravel or dirt roads: | Your tires do not have as much traction on loose gravel and dirt roads as they do on concrete and asphalt roads. When driving on gravel or dirt, you must slow down. It will take you much longer to stop and it is much easier to skid when turning.

hasPart.name: If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should:

about.name: If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should: | If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, avoid especially slippery areas, such as ice patches, wet leaves, oil, or deep puddles. The safest surface for driving is a dry, solid surface.

suggestedAnswer.text: Maintain the posted speed to make it through the water.

comment.text: Maintain the posted speed to make it through the water.
Avoid the puddle if possible.

suggestedAnswer.text: Shift into neutral as you drive through the water.

comment.text: Shift into neutral as you drive through the water.
Avoid the puddle if possible.

answerExplanation.text: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, avoid especially slippery areas, such as ice patches, wet leaves, oil, or deep puddles. The safest surface for driving is a dry, solid surface.

comment.text: If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should: | To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, avoid especially slippery areas, such as ice patches, wet leaves, oil, or deep puddles. The safest surface for driving is a dry, solid surface.

hasPart.name: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do?

about.name: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do?

hasPart.assesses: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do? | You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and lights. Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed. If you are within an intersection, drive through the intersection first and then stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.

comment.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.

comment.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.

comment.text: Stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.

acceptedAnswer.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.

comment.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.

answerExplanation.text: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and lights. Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed. If you are within an intersection, drive through the intersection first and then stop.

comment.text: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do? | You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and lights. Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed. If you are within an intersection, drive through the intersection first and then stop.
